data.title: Atomic ID?
data.body:
I thought this is free software after all.
So, why is it necessary to force a user to sign up for an Atomic ID for just being able to work with the editor?
This should be optional.

data.title: Game testing,  Functional test
data.body:
Currently, the functional testing of a game is done manually. The goal of this issue is to take a game project from source code to playing it, in an automated fashion. It seems like a simple thing, but it can tell you if all is good or things have changed, perhaps for the worse.

How to do this?

The entire processing needs to be driven by a cross platform script of some sort, so it can be done by the user, at will. The current plan is to create an AtomicEditor plugin, where you can select a list projects to build and run.

Then, enhance AtomicTool to the heavy lifting, it can already do most of the pieces, but needs a command to just do it, without argument(s), and all languages. Use either the AtomicTool player, or platform native game to test.

In order to play the game, add an event record/playback feature into the Input module, like the demo mode in Quake, to make the game do something.

For results reporting, use existing logs and logging features to tell what happened.

data.title: [AtomicNET] Game fixed updating pauses when creating nodes
[AtomicNET] Update() is called along with Start() on CSComponent creation
data.body:
You can't have an initialization method in a CSComponent that initializes variables that you access in Update() because it's called once at the constructor before you have the chance to setup anything, consider this code:
`MyNode.CreateComponent<MyComponent>().InitVariables(someData);`
this code which is very handy in a number of cases simply isn't possible.

data.title: [AtomicNET] Errors only traceable to Application.cs:L73
data.body: When I try to debug an error in which I'm accessing a null reference somewhere in a CSComponent, the only stack trace I get points only to that line with no other useful debug information whatsoever. I'm using VS2017.

data.title: [AtomicNET] Provide a better way to implement the 'magic' callbacks
data.body:
CSComponent has these magic callbacks like `Start()` and `Update(float dt)` that you gotta blindly implement, the problem is, if for some reason the signature doesn't match, you have a situation that's very hard to debug, say you have `Update()`, it won't work and it may not be obvious why.
In my opinion we need to either provide overridable methods, or maybe just let the user subscribe to the events and don't provide any magical stuff at all... some other engines have IDE plugins to help you with the magical stuff, but in my opinion Atomic shouldn't do any magic. Is there any reason why CSComponent doesn't have virtual methods you can override?

data.title: [Atomic Editor] Unusuable, sometimes crashing
data.body:
The Editor is lagging slow and thus unusuable.
Sometimes even crashes occur.
The Problem may be here: (taken from the CEF log, Messages repeated all over again):

> [0823/024737:ERROR:gles2_cmd_decoder.cc(4643)] Error: 5 for Command kPostSubBufferCHROMIUM
> [0823/024737:ERROR:gpu_channel_manager.cc(222)] Exiting GPU process because some drivers cannot recover from problems.
> [0823/024737:ERROR:gpu_process_transport_factory.cc(761)] Lost UI shared context.
> [0823/024738:ERROR:gles2_cmd_decoder.cc(13126)] Context lost because SwapBuffers failed.

My machine is a Lenovo X230, INTEL HD 4000, Win7, newest drivers

A solution may be:
(Taken from  https://github.com/cefsharp/CefSharp/issues/1634)

Simply workaround is to use the --disable-gpu command line flag
â€¦
//settings.CefCommandLineArgs.Add(â€œdisable-gpuâ€, â€œ1â€);

Suggestion: Put a setting in the JSON to disable GPU

data.title: [AtomicNET] Disabling native code debugging in VS2017 causes a crash
data.body:
I just found out something very weird when doing the steps I describe in this wiki page:
https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/C%23-project-using-the-engine-as-a-library
If you don't enable this: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8399299/29722266-7ccc5832-8996-11e7-9c13-75cb483a7ab9.png)
The application crashes on startup... the same happens when you create it from the Editor and the disable that.
Why does that happen? Can somebody else confirm?

data.title: [API] Math Improvements
Optional submodules
data.body: By popular demand (from @Alan-FGR) this change implements pulling submodules only if features that require these submodules are enabled. So disabling `ATOMIC_CPLUSPLUS_EXAMPLES` will not pull examples and disabling `ATOMIC_WEBVIEW` will not pull CEF.

data.title: [Atomic2D] Support navigation and 2D physics on the same orientation plane
data.body: Navigation works on the XZ plane, and 2D physics works on the XY plane, thus making them fully unusable together, what could be useful for planar 2D top-down games like shooters, racers or RTSs where you don't need to use the 3D physics.

data.title: [CMake/Profiler] Qt libraries are not copied to the profiler output folder
data.body: I just cmaked Atomic here with the profiler and the resulting VS2017 project isn't configured to copy the dlls to the profiler output folder, so you can't run the binary directly after building it, you have to either copy or configure that manually. @rokups ;)

data.title: Bump CMake version and initialize new variables in Text3DFreeType
data.body: Just a few things i overlooked on last PR.

data.title: [Building] How to build without the Submodules, specifically CEF and the Examples?
data.body: I've asked this numerous times on Gitter, but never was able to find a solution and always surrendered to the tyranny of the pesky submodules ðŸ¤£... but it's really getting annoying. After cloning non-recursively, if you run the shell/batch scripts they start downloading the massive binaries... if you try to cmake it same thing happens, and I don't think people should be doing that directly because any customization fails without running the  javascript magic anyway ðŸ˜„... steps on how to build just Atomic without CEF (and by consequence the editor) and the Examples would be greatly appreciated... it doesn't have to be fancy, just some very rough steps on how to achieve such a feat, and I'll be happy to add them to the wiki with proper formatting and in a friendly presentation.

data.title: [AtomicNET] CreateComponent returns a new (allocated) bogus component.
Third Party Updates
data.body:
Continuation of https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1629, rebased to master with IntVector2 fix.

Thanks to @rokups!

data.title: Add Multicolumn List Widget
Merge with upstream
data.body:
Merge with upstream. Basically Urho3D 1.7 + few fixes.

Most notable since last merge:

* IK updates
* WebP support
* TMX file format updates
* Some Text3D updates (oversampling, etc)

data.title: Exposed SetColor for UIBargraph so that it can be used from script
[UI] Can't set cursor image
data.body: The Urho UI provides a method to set the cursor image however Turbobadger doesn't offer this so this functionality went away with SystemUI.

data.title: [UI] Scroller doesn't work by code
data.body: The scroll container only seems to work if using a tb.txt to do the layout and controls don't show up if you add them by C#.
